Indian shares climbed the most since February 1, led by a record rally in HDFC Bank after the Reserve Bank allowed foreign investors to hold more of the country’s largest private sector lender.The S&P BSE Sensex jumped as much as 1.5 percent to 28,726 in opening trades while the Nifty gained 1.3 percent to 8,896.
